strIntroduction: Incense has been an essential part of Japan's religious and daily life for centuries. These Monko workshops teach appreciation of incense. Participants are asked not to wear any perfumes. Monko workshop: Experience the distinctive fragrances of high-grade incense woods. Learn to 'listen' to incense and distinguish fragrances. For 2 to 5 people. Schedule: Monday - Saturday, 10:30 a.m. and 2:30 p.m. Approx. 45 min. duration. Monko Practice Workshop: Experience the entire Monko process, from preparing the censer to burning the Incense wood. For 2 to 4 people. Schedule: Monday - Saturday, 10:30 a.m. and 2:30 p.m. Approx. 60 min. duration. Genji Incense Workshop: participate in a sophisticated game, determining which of five censers have the same fragrance. Green tea and sweets will be served! For reserved groups of 5 or more. Schedule: Monday - Friday, 2:30 p.m. Approx. 90 min. duration Scented Sachet Workshop: Learn to mix ingredients to create your own original fragrance. The natural ingredients keep insects away, so scented sachets are often put in drawers and wardrobes. For 2 to 40 people. Schedule: Monday - Friday, 2:30 p.m. Approx. 45 min. duration. Kneaded Incense Workshop: Learn to mix ingredients to create your own original kneaded incense. You can take away the kneaded incense you make in the workshop and enjoy burning it at home. For 2 to 40 people. Schedule: Monday - Friday, 2:30 p.m. Approx. 45 min. duration.
strTitle: Listen to Incense or Join an Incense Making Course in Kyoto

strIntroduction: In this 7-hour walking tour, Last Samurai, the licensed tour guide Samurai Joe will take you to any places you would like to visit in Kyoto! Samurai Joe was featured on TV for about 110 times in Japan and 29 times in foreign countries. In other words, if you join this tour, you can explore anywhere you want in Kyoto with the famous samurai tour guide! Samurai Joe is an 87-year-old tour guide, who is well-known as the Last Samurai with media appearance and the uniqueness of his tour. He was born in 1929 and after he experienced WW2, he moved to the U.S., then started his tour for guests from foreign countries after he came back to Japan. He is the oldest active licensed guide in Japan and is elected as Kyoto's Omotenashi tourism ambassador. When you join this tour, you will never believe that Samurai Joe is already 87-year-old! It is a tour full of laughter and you can visit many places in Kyoto with Joe's advanced knowledge so that you can also understand the background of Kyoto's history. The highlight of this tour is the samurai show performance by Samurai Joe. Samurai Joe lets you to throw an apple in the air and he will cut it into two pieces with his sword! You can never experience this jaw dropping experience in other tours. Because of its originality and uniqueness, many of the guests say that the tour was one of the best tour they've ever had. Don't miss this opportunity to explore one of Japan's historical city Kyoto by taking this unique tour with the Last Samurai, Samurai Joe, through our reservation system! This tour is not available on Saturdays,and subject to his availability. There are 2 options available for this tour: Option 1: 7-hour Walking Tour with Samurai Joe Add-on option: 1 hour extension
strTitle: Enjoy 1 Day Walking Private Tour with Kyoto's Last Samurai!

strIntroduction: Have an amazing time petting and taking pictures with these cute owls at this owl cafe in Fukuoka. This is a new and interesting themed cafe concept that has begun to spread all over Japan and has become a must-try activity for visitors to Japan. Before meeting the owls, you'll have a chance to order a drink of your preference, before a member of the staff carefully explains the proper way to handle the owl to avoid any harm to you and the owl. Please listen attentively to their explanation so that you can enjoy an amazing time with the owls. Here is the flow of the experience: - enter the shop and hear the instructions of the staff (first 15 minutes of the experience) - spend time with the owls (for about 35 minutes) - end of the experience You'll then need to clean your hands with hand sanitizer before you can touch and pet the owls. After your time is up, you'll be able to visit the gift shop and find a unique owl-related souvenir! Other rules to observe: - only the staff can bring and take away the owls. - don't let go off the leash. - avoid touching the owls anywhere else except for their heads. - turn off the flash when taking a photo. This is definitely a rare, unique experience that you should definitely not miss while you are visiting Japan! Reserve your seat now! It is also possible to rent the entire place for 1 hour! Available for up to 20 people at once! The opening time of the cafe in Fukuoka is as follows: Weekday: 12:00 - 20:00 (last entry at 19:00) Weekend: 11:00 - 20:00 (last entry at 19:00) Closed: Mondays
strTitle: Reservation for Lovely Owl Cafe Hakata, Fukuoka

strIntroduction: This is a walking sightseeing tour of Kobe with a visit to Nada sake brewery, including buffet style lunch!, the perfect way to explore this area of Japan in a single day, with a round-trip tour departing from Kyoto. The tour participants will meet at New Miyako Hotel in Kyoto and walk to JR Kyoto station to board a 1-hour train ride to Kobe's Sannomiya station. In Kobe you will walk around Kitano Ijinkan District, famous for the several Western architecture residences built during the Meiji area that served as the home to first diplomats and expats who settled in Japan. The tour will then move on to the ANA Crown Plaza Kobe Hotel where you will enjoy a buffet style Western & Japanese lunch, before heading to Meriken Park, dotted with unique artwork and located right in front of the sea, with panoramic views of the port and landmarks such as the Kobe tower. You will also have some time to do some shopping in the area. You will then go back to Sannomiya Station where you'll take the Hanshin line train to Sumiyoshi Station to visit the Hakutsuru Sake Brewery Museum, where you'll learn about the different methods for making sake and will have a chance to taste this delicious wine rice. Finally you will board a train at Sumiyoshi Station that will bring you back to Kyoto station.
strTitle: Visit Kobe and a sake brewery in a walking tour from Kyoto!

It is made up of four floors with tanks containing deep sea creatures, sharks, coral and tropical fish. The Mihama American Village is a large theme park in central Okinawa. strIntroduction: In this 1 day tour with a tour guide, you can visit Odawara castle, make Kamaboko and stroll around Hakone Yumoto station from Shinjuku, Tokyo! If you join this tour, you may experience famous tourist attractions around Odawara & Hakone area in a day! Odawara castle is a landmark in Odawara, Kanagawa prefecture, which was first built in 1447 and was in use in the Edo period. You have a chance to see the castle tower and get into the history museum, so you can learn the history of Japan while walking inside the fascinating castle! Have you ever heard of Kamaboko? Kamaboko is known as fish paste or fish cake in English, and it is a Japanese processed seafood product. Because of the unique texture, it is loved by all generations in Japan. The most popular Kamaboko store in Japan is called Suzuhiro. In this tour, you can visit Suzuhiro Kamaboko museum and make your original Kamaboko at the cooking class! You may buy different kinds of Kamaboko at the souvenir shop too. After you make your Kamaboko, you can stroll around Hakone Yumoto station. Once you got off the station, you can see many stores on the street, where you can buy souvenirs and eat small local foods. For transportation, you will be using Odakyu Romance Car and Hakone Tozan Railway. Buy Bentos(Japanese style lunch box) for your lunch and relax in the train after your depart from Shinjuku station. From the window of Hakone Tozan Railway, you may see the beautiful scenery of greenery in Hakone! This tour is available everyday except for Wednesdays. Itinery: Meet your guide at Shinjuku Station. *Add-on option for hotel-pickup is available too. Move to Odawara station by Odakyu Romance Car (90 min) Arrive at Odawara Castle (120 min) Stroll around Castle tower and enter the History Museum! Move to Kazamatsuri Station by Hakone Tozan Railway (10 min) Make Kamaboko at Suzuhiro Kamaboko Museum (120 min) You can make your own Kamaboko! Move to Hakone-Yumoto station by Hakone Tozan Railway (10 min) Stroll around Hakone-Yumoto (60 min) You may buy some souvenirs and eat local foods! Arrive at Hakone Yumoto Station (Drop-out option1) Get back to Shinjuku station by Odakyu Romance Car (Drop-out option2) *You can either choose Hakone-Yumoto Station or Shinjuku Station for the end of this tour. The price only includes Guide Fee. In addition to the price, other fees might cost depending on your tour. Admission Fee : 650 JPY (Adult) / 250 JPY (Children under 11) Total amount of Transportation Fee : -Drop out option 1 (Hakone Yumoto Station): About 2100 JPY (Adult) / 1050 JPY (Children under 11) -Drop out option 2 (Shinjuku Station): About 4000 JPY (Adult) / 2000 JPY (Children under 11) Kamaboko making class: 1620 JPY
strTitle: Day Trip to Odawara Castle & Kamaboko Making from Tokyo

strIntroduction: Located in the suburbs west of Kyoto, the water basin of Katsura River has one of the most captivating landscapes in Japan. Lush green vegetation and a river with crystal clear waters have made it incredibly popular among locals and tourists. The blooming flowers, the trees, and the river have inspires many other artists through time. You can admire this splendid landscape in a unique way with this stand up paddle boarding tour. It's an offshoot sport of surfing, where the rider stands up on a board and propels through the water by moving a paddle. The range of vision on SUP, as its often abbreviated, is greater than that of a canoe or a kayak, and will allow you to experience Kyoto in a completely different way! In this tour we will paddle board on the stream of the Katsura river. You will feel the breeze on your face as you breath in fresh air that will refresh your body and soul! If you want to take a break from the temples, join this tour and experience this new sport while continue to explore Kyoto! Duration: Approx. 2 hours
strTitle: Experience stand up paddle boarding in Kyoto!

strIntroduction: The food tasting tour is led by Minnesota born, Jason Davidson. Learn about traditional Japanese food such as konbu, dashimaki, Obanzai among others. Naturally, you will have the chance to indulge in these delicacies of Japanese cuisine. This 3-hour walking tour will guide you through the shotengai (shopping street) of the quaint Fushimi district of Kyoto, visiting 8 to 10 family owned and operated shops, some of which have more than a 100 years of history! Taste something different at each location, and learn about the seasonal food that is so beloved in Japan, offering a wonderful insight into the Japanese kitchen! Whether you are an expert gourmet, or just want to learn more about Kyoto's food culture, this tour will satisfy both your curiosity and your stomach. The tour is conducted in English and children are welcome to join. The Sake tasting tour also takes 3 hours and involves a convivial stroll, chatting and tasting fine sake as you walk around Fushimi district, the epicenter of sake brewing in Kyoto. You will visit a museum and brewery, a liquor store specializing in sake from Fushimi, and a small family-owned and operated brewery that produces only Junmaishu (pure rice sake).
strTitle: Enjoy a sake or food tasting walking tour in Kyoto!

strIntroduction: Despite its great natural beauty, breathtaking views and historic cultural sites, Mt Hieizan has few foreign visitors because reaching the summit involves several bewildering transport transfers, various mountain trails, and a variety of confusing and expensive tickets. This walking tour aims to take all those daunting tasks out of the visitor's hands for a hassle-free and pleasurable hike around this landmark of Kyoto. You will depart from Kyoto Station, and then transfer on to a traditional cable car to finally reach the summit. On the half day tour, you will see stunning views of Kyoto and Lake Biwa, and even all the way to Osaka on a clear day. Explore the amazing temples of the Enryakuji forest monastery complex, stroll through lush green forest and learn about the monks who once lived there and their intriguing history. The full day tour will consist of the same itinerary, except before climbing the mountain, you will explore Lake Biwa and Biwako Canal, as well as the Miidera Temple complex, so often seen in Samurai films, with its huge bronze bell. In the foothills, where the God of the mountain is said to dwell, you will also visit beautiful Hiyoshi Taisha Shinto shrine. Return to Kyoto down the western slope via cable car to experience a different side of Mt Hieizan. As this is a walking tour, please wear comfortable clothes and shoes. Itineraries are subject to changes in bad weather, or in winter. Half Day Tour Departure point: JR Kyoto Station, 10:00 at latest Duration: approx. 5-6 hours Full Day Tour Departure point: JR Kyoto Station, 08:30 to 09:30 Duration: approx. 7-8 hours Tour prices include transportation fees (train, bus, cable car, and/or ropeway) and temple admission fees only. Fees for any additional activities chosen by guests, and/or refreshments are the responsibility of the guests.
strTitle: Explore Mt Hieizan in a walking tour from Kyoto!

strIntroduction: As the famous novelist Ernest Hemingway once said: "'It is by riding a bicycle that you learn the contours of a country best, since you have to sweat up the hills and coast down them." That is why we have carefully selected the must-see spots in northern Kyoto so you can really experience this ancient city. The neighborhood surrounding Kinukake Road is rich in nature, culture, and history and the best way to exploring is by pedaling along this road accompanied by an English-speaking guide. Itinerary Meet at 9:00 AM We will start our day by visiting Ryoanji, the Zen temple famous for its rock garden. The simple design made of rocks, pebbles, and moss will quiet your mind and makes an ideal place for some meditation before moving on with the next stop on the itinerary. Toji-in A Zen temple dedicated to Ashikaga Takauji, the first shogun of the Ashikaga Dynasty. Famous for its beautiful Japanese garden and tea house. Ninnaji A temple that belongs to the Shingon sect of Buddhism and is listed as a World Heritage Site. It was also here that some members of the Japanese Imperial Family served as head priests towards the end of the Meiji Era. It is also famous for its late blooming cherry trees. Myoshinji The biggest Zen temple in Japan featuring 46 sub-temples. Several winding paths flanked by high walls make even locals get lost. It's best to explore it with an experienced guide. Demon Street In ancient times, it was believed that Ichino street at Jokyo District was a border line between this world and land of the dead, where people came across “Yokai", demons or evil creatures roaming the street at night. Even now you can see various funny demon statutes in front of the local shops. Additional Information Total distance: Approximately 8 kilometers Duration: 3 – 3.5 hours Price includes: Entrance Fees, Bike Rental, Helmet and English Speaking Guide.
strTitle: Enjoy a guided bike tour and visit amazing temples in Kyoto!

strIntroduction: This is a bicycle tour that goes around the city of Yokohama, offering tourists a great way to explore the sights. Unlike a bus tour, you will learn a lot more about the sights by pedaling around and listening to the thorough explanations of the local guide, who is very knowledgeable about Yokohama and knows the best routes around the city. You will visit Yamashita Park, explore China Town, one of the largest in the world, and indulge in delicious Chinese snacks before getting on a ferry at the port of Yokohama. The tour has a duration of half a day, but it will take you through the city's most famous sightseeing spots and it's perfect for a tight schedule. Don't miss the chance to explore one Japan's most vibrant cities in a unique way.
strTitle: Explore Yokohama's best sightseeing spots by bike and ferry!

strIntroduction: This guided walking tour is a great way to explore Japan’s ancient capital with more than 1200 years of history. In Kyoto, there are thousands of shrines, temples and Japanese style gardens, which means deciding what to visit can be a daunting task. We hand-picked the top must-see spots of southeast Kyoto, allowing you to cover this area in a half day. An experienced guide will give teach you about the history and culture of Koto from a local point of view. First we will visit the Tofukuji Temple, a Zen temple built in the 13th century. The temple has several “Karesansui”, the dry landscape gardens made with rocks and sand. Learn about their history and meaning, and calm your mind contemplating it just like Buddhist monks do. Next, we will walk into a nice residential neighborhood, where Fushimi Inari Shrine is located. After enjoying the local atmosphere, we will walk up the hill through the endless, vibrant red Torii gates, and spot the shrine’s symbol: the fox statues. This beautiful landscapes appeared in the famous film “Memoirs of a Geisha” and will prove to be great photo opportunities! Before sunset, we will leave Fushimi Inari shrine to head to the entertainment district, Gion. The area comes alive in the evening, and you will be able to take in the view of traditional teahouses, red lanterns, and Maiko on the streets, the quintessential Kyoto experience. The tour starts at 2:00 PM and doesn't require a great fitness level, however you must be able to walk for an extended period of time.
strTitle: Enjoy a Kyoto walking tour, Tofukuji, Fushimi Inari & Gion

strIntroduction: How about experiencing Japan's traditional side? In this activity, you will be able to choose from a wide selection of kimonos and learn how to put it on. You will also learn and experience a traditional Japanese tea ceremony, famous around the world as the pinnacle of Japanese refinement and etiquette. Then, you will have the opportunity to go to a nearby temple to take some pictures wearing the kimono. It will definitely be a one in a lifetime experience and a highlight of your trip to Japan. Itinerary: ・Starting time at 10:30 AM or 3 PM. ・Meet your host at 10:30 AM (or 3 PM) outside Exit 3 of Shitennojimae-Yuhigaoka Station of Tanimachi subway line. ・Walk 3 minute from the station to a Japanese apartment. ・Select your favorite Kimono and learn how to put it on. Your host will show you how, step by step. ・Now it's time for the Japanese tea ceremony. You will learn its rules and etiquette, and then you'll have the opportunity to try it out and make your own green tea. Enjoy your fresh tea with some Japanese traditional sweets. ・Lastly, if you wish, you can also visit Shitennoji temple, the oldest Buddhist temple in Japan. Where you will have a great chance to take memorable photos. Say cheese! The activity takes about 2 hours, depending on the weather conditions and the number of participants. Please inquire about availability and confirm the schedule of the activity.
strTitle: Enjoy a Japanese tea ceremony and wear a Kimono in Osaka!

strIntroduction: Learn about the rich tradition of the Japanese incense with Mon-koh, the Japanese incense ceremony that will help you practice mindfulness by learning to meditate concentrating on the aroma of the incense. Or attend a workshop where you'll learn to make your own incense sachet. This is a wonderful opportunity to learn about a unique aspect of Japanese culture. These activities are offered by the Center for Arts and Wellness in the heart of Tokyo in the Roppongi district. Whether you are staying a few days in Tokyo or just passing by, take a moment our of your hectic itinerary to enjoy a moment of peace and relaxation, and learn about the rich world of the Japanese incense. It will definitely be a highlight of your trip! There are 2 types of workshops available: Mon-koh and Incense Sachet making. Mon-koh is a Japanese incense ceremony in a contemporary style. Traditionally, Japanese people offered incense as a sacred gift to the Gods. It's said that the history of incense started at the same time as people started using fire. In this workshop, you will learn about the history of Japanese Incense, brought into Japan during the Nara period. The objective during the Mon-koh ceremony is to "listen" to the incense, instead of just "smelling" it. You will need to sharpen your five senses to maximize its effects. It will leave you feeling relaxed and happy. In the incense sachet workshop, you will learn about the ingredients and select your favorite ones to make your own incense sachet. It's a great opportunity to take back home a special souvenir.
strTitle: Meditate with Japanese incense or make your own sachet!

strTitle: Enjoy a Night Tour with Dinner, Mt Moiwa & Mt Okura, Sapporo

strIntroduction: The history of fake food making started early in the Taisho Era - nearly 100 years ago - as a handicraft. Later, people started using them to display the menu at restaurants. These displays help you to see what kind of food is serve at restaurants. It is a very unique culture and many restaurants in Japan display the foods that almost perfectly replicate the real foods! Recently, it has become a big trend in Japan for people to experience making these fake foods at the factories where they are manufactured. With this experience you can choose one menu from the choices of six. From the categories of sweets, you will make fruits with cream and decorate them nicely. In the other category, you can either make a bento lunch box or sushi. The choice of the design is up to you so that you can make your unique replica! The steps are simple and the instructor will teach you thoroughly, so don’t worry. Once you have completed your replica, you will attach a clip, strap or key chain. It will be completed within one hour. You should be proud of yourself making the item and show it to your friends back in the country. *Design pocket *Business hour: 10:00 AM-18:00 PM *Time for the activity: 30-45 minutes *Age: 3 years and over (Children require parental supervision)
strTitle: Enjoy fun Experience Making Plastic Food in Osaka!

strIntroduction: Bicycle touring is the best way to find hidden alleys and learn the geography in your destination! We offer three routes with an experienced English speaking guide. Choose your tour from the three below to suit your schedule, interests, and stamina! 1. Kyoto South Course Itinerary (The easiest and shortest route ) -Toji Temple Buddhist temple founded in the late 700s. Toji’s Pagoda is a landmark of Kyoto. -Ryukoku University There are impressive western-style architectures built during the Meiji Era. -Pedal along the Takase Canal and the Kamogawa River -Gion Cycle around an entertaining district where you might come across geiko or maiko! -Tofukuji Temple One of the Five Mountain Temples in the Rinzai sect, founded in 1236. -Fushimi Inari Shrine Shinto shrine famous for its thousands of orange tori gates you might have seen in the movie, “Sayuri”. Cost: 6,000 JPY Distance: Approx. 16 kilometers Duration: 3-4 hours Difficulty: As easy as riding a bike! Includes: Bike rental, Helmet, English-speaking guide, Water Meeting Details: 10 am or 13 pm at JR Kyoto Station 2. Kyoto North Course Itinerary -Nijo Castle Flatland castle registered as UNESCO World Heritage Site. Built during the days of the Shogunate to demonstrate the power of Tokugawa Ieyasu. -Kitano Tenmangu The shrine dedicated to Sugawara no Michizane who was a poet, scholar and politician during the Heian Period. -Kingakuji Temple Zen temple beautifully covered in gold foil. Used to be a retirement villa of the shogun Ashikaga Yoshimitsu. -Imperial Palace Park By the end of the Edo Era, the neighborhood was a residential area for old samurai and court nobles. -Kyoto University Many Nobel laureates come from or work at this national university. -Lunch Enjoy the local foods in Kyoto! -Philosophers’ Path Cobbled pathway lined by cherry trees where philosophers and literary writers walked for meditation. -Nanzenji Aqueduct Top of the Five Mountain Temples in Kyoto, established in 1291. Scarlett Johansson stands at the gate of Nanzenji in the movie, “Lost in Translation”. -Gion A famous entertainment district with many machiya houses where geiko and maiko dance and perfomance. Cost: 8,000 JPY Distance: Approx. 23 kilometers Duration: 4-5 hours Difficulty: Moderate Includes: Bike rental, Helmet, English-speaking guide, Water, Lunch, Temple entrance fee Meeting Details: 10 am at JR Kyoto Station 3. Kyoto Full Course (Combined 2 courses of Kyoto South & North) This is the best tour for those who like to visit all the popular sightseeing spots within a short time! -Toji Temple -Ryukoku University -Nijo Castle -Kinkakuji Temple -Lunch -Imperial Palace Park -Kyoto University -Philosophers’ Path -Gion -Tofukuji Temple -Fushimi Inari Shrine Cost: 10,000 JPY Distance: Approx. 30 kilometers Duration: 6-7 hours Difficulty: Moderate Includes: Bike rental, Helmet, English-speaking guide, Water, Lunch, Temple entrance fee Meeting Details: 10 am at JR Kyoto Station
strTitle: Try an Amazing Bike Tour with 3 Options, Kyoto!

strIntroduction: In recent years a lot of books related to Maiko and Geiko have been published - even in English, but it is still a world shrouded in secrecy, even for the Japanese! Many imagine it is very expensive to have dinner with and be entertained by Geisha and Maiko, making people hesitate to enter their world! On this tour you are allowed to take pictures with Geiko and Maiko. While exploring Kyoto's most famous geisha district you will also find a lot of beautiful and elegant Japanese scenery such as traditional wooden machiya merchant houses. Through an English interpreter you will get firsthand information about the history of Gion and other representative areas of Geisha. The more you know about Gion’s history, the more your interest in them will grow. While you have dinner you will have the chance to ask questions to the Maiko directly. So take this special opportunity to know the Geisha world in Kyoto! It will surely make your trip more memorable! The tour schedule is as follows: 13:30 meet with an English interpreter Meeting point: Starbucks Gion (the 1st floor of the APA hotel Gion) Take a walk in the Gion area on foot. 15:45 Depart for a nearby Japanese restaurant 15:50 Arrive at the Japanese restaurant Order some drinks (optional and paid by customers), dinner will be served. 16:00 A maiko will come to meet with you. Dance show with recorded music. Converse with a Maiko while being entertained. Take a photo or shoot a video with a Maiko. 17:00 The Maiko will leave you and you can finish your dinner. Tour disbands.
strTitle: Enjoy Dinner with Maiko and Explore Gion in Kyoto!

strIntroduction: When thinking of Japanese food, many people think of Sushi, Tempura, Japanese pancakes, or miso soup, but at this cooking lesson you will be introduced and taught how to make Obanzai, famous among Japanese people for its home-style dishes from the Kyoto area. Originally created in a merchants house in old Japan with the desire for economic savings through reducing waste. The meals also seek to ensure a healthy life with well-balanced ingredients. The 90 minute lesson start at either 11:00 or 16:30. Its highlight is learning how to cook imaginative and original Obanzai dishes that have been handed down from person to person. Made mainly from vegetables and cooked as simple dishes, Obanzai is a cuisine that utilizes seasonal ingredients without waste and has drawn a lot of interest recently. Throughout the cooking process you will gain a lot of awareness about culture and history, the tradition of Kyoto and a simple lifestyle. The colorful food arrangements and combination of ingredients keeps a good nourishment balance which are amazing and the light and delicate taste of Kyoto-style seasoning is really healthy and tasty. Enjoy discovering a new local vegetable that you have never seen before and communicate with locals throughout the lesson! This wonderful memory of cooking Obanzai will not fade.
strTitle: Enjoy Cooking Healthy Japanese Vegetarian Dishes in Kyoto!

strIntroduction: This wedding experience in Kyoto is almost all inclusive and will be almost everything that you could want or need and is especially recommend for couples who are interested in wearing Kimono's and the culture and traditions of a Japanese wedding ceremony. The schedule is as below: 1. Put on your wedding wear then have your hair and makeup set by a professional hairdresser. The Japanese formal wedding Kimono for women is made out of a high-quality white silk called Shiromuku. The bridegroom wears a formal divided skirt called a Hakama. 2. Experience the traditional Japanese ceremony briefly with Sake and a light meal. 3. Head to a Shrine by car and enjoy the atmosphere of a Japanese wedding and take pictures in front of the sacred Shinto building. This condensed Japanese traditional wedding experience takes 2.5-3 hours and you can enjoy the whole of experience with an interpreter explaining the meaning of its history, tradition and customs during the service. Additional services offer the opportunity of having photos taken by a professional photographer, the formalwear for your parent and friends and a prayer for your eternal happiness by a Shinto priest. Without a doubt you will enjoy the Japanese wedding experience.
strTitle: Experience Traditional Japanese Wedding & Kimono in Kyoto!

strIntroduction: I can share a wonderful Japanese cooking experiences with you! What you can learn: In my class, you can learn making various kinds of sushi rolls. Also we can taste traditional Japanese dishes which I’ve already made. I have 2 classes a day (lunch or dinner). Each class has a maximum 4 people. Time Schedule: 10:00 (or 15:30): Meet up at Sasazuka Station, Tokyo - Shopping street/supermarket tour 10:30 (or 16:00) Start cooking class - explaining Japanese food - demonstration how to cook - try to make Sushi 12:00 (or 17:30) Tasting time 12:30 (or 18:00) End of the class Notes: I care about what you eat. If you have any allergy or eat Halal food, please let me know in advance

strIntroduction: Rent gorgeous formal kimonos like Furisode for young ladies, Montsuki Hakama for men and shrine visits. These kimonos are worn for occasions like gala, wedding or tea party. Checking in at our reception counter with some basic information filled in, you will be given a rental bag and shown the way to start choosing kimonos. Furisode is the traditional formal attire with gorgeous patterns and long sleeves for unmarried young ladies. We have three ranks of furisode by different material and patterns. This plan lets you choosing your favorite furisode, obi and decorative items when you come to the store. A false fur shawl is also available to go with your look. Gentlemen can put on the traditional formal attired called Montsuki Hakama, a hakama suit with family crest. It takes about 30 mins. Choose kimonos and get dressed. If the ladies would like to have the hair done, hairdressing service is also available with extra charges which takes an additional 15-20 minutes. (Hairdressing is a very popular option so a reservation is highly recommended.) Including the time to leave your baggage, the entire process from entering our store until departure is about 1 hr - 1.5 hrs. Not sure where to go? Our information counter will be happy to help with some one-day trip advice. If you are short of yen, a currency exchange service is also available there. Feel free to explore Kyoto at your own pace. Take your time relaxing or having a cup of tea at the local cafe or tea room. Find a quiet temple or shrine. Wearing a traditional costume, you may feel the authentic atmosphere at the heart of Japan. Remember to come back by 19:30 pm and return the kimonos. If you want to wear kimonos at night, you can also return the attire on the following day with an extra extension charge.
strTitle: Premium Kimono Rental in Kyoto: Furisode, Montsuki Hakama!

strIntroduction: Maiko is female performing artists working in Gion area whose skills include performing various Japanese arts such as classical music, dance and games. A maiko is a geiko minor apprentice from the age of 15 to 20 before her adulthood. Yumeyakata's Maiko Makeover plan does not have an age limit for the Maiko plan. Our staff who used to be a maiko, will make you up and dress you up like a real maiko. Using her skill who was the maiko since years ago, she will teach you how to pose and dance like a maiko. This package includes the studio photography, so why don't you take the pictures and give it to your family or friends as souvenirs?

strIntroduction: If you are a true big fan of Japanese traditional art and culture, you definitely shouldn’t miss this incredible tour program! This tour program will take you to an Atelier in Asakusa, Tokyo, where you can enjoy experiencing the traditional Japanese weaving methods. You can select your favorite thread out of ten kinds of threads and weave original coasters, center piece, and place mat. There are eight weaving machines available at the atelier, and you will get lost in your own world while weaving your original merchandise. The flow of the clothes dyeing experience will be as follows: - Choose the warps that you want to use - Choose the wefts that you want to use - Choose the threads that you want to use and start weaving - Tap on the machine and make your original merchandise! Children above three years old can join this tour program if they want to. This tour program everyday except on Wednesdays from 10:00 - 19:00. Reservation is difficult to make, so we suggest you to use our reservation service to book with no hassles!

strIntroduction: If you are a food lover and want to hunt for good food of Tokyo, we recommend you to make a reservation for this tour program as soon as possible! You can enjoy an incredible food tour in Tokyo and fill your tummy with many delicious food of Tokyo at one of Tokyo’s most famous food spots. There are four different types of tour programs that you can reserve. 1. Aka Chouchin Tour Aka chouchin (red lantern) is the symbol of the Izakaya, which has similar concept to Spanish tapas bar. This aka chouchin tour will take you to Ebisu, an area named after the popular beer Yebisu, where you can enjoy many different types of food. Ebisu can be considered as a huge theme park of food at the center of Tokyo, as many new restaurants opening in Ebisu every month. Ebisu still also has few local old staples, and this tour will take you to both, old and new sides of food culture in Ebisu. This tour is available every day from 17:30 - 20:30. 2. Showa Retro Tour Showa Retro Tour will take you to Koenji, where you can find many Tokyo’s most authentic local food. Koenji is not very famous among foreigners, yet is not very famous among local teenagers or young adults, but it possesses an indescribable charm that can’t be found at other places in central Tokyo. You can escape from the Tokyo’s busy lifestyle and step into the little neighborhood of Koenji to gain insight on how Japanese locals enjoy their daily lives. This tour is available on Tuesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday, and Sunday from 17:00 - 20:30. 3. Ameyokocho Tour You will have a day visit to Tokyo’s famous shopping streets called Ameya Yokocho (Ameyoko), which has over 400 shops and restaurants for you to troll around. People of all ages can have fun at Ameyokocho, and you can enjoy the lively local atmosphere and various “Japanese soul food” there. Streets at Ameyokocho are very busy from early in the morning until late night. This tour is available every day from 11:00 - 14:00. 4. Premium Food and Drinks Tour Different from other tours, this tour is a little bit luxurious compare to the other tours. A lot of various types of Japanese alcohols will be introduced in this tour, so you will be able to enjoy Craft beer, Japanese Sake, Japanese Shochu, and Japanese Whisky. You will also have a chance to experience the authentic Japanese course dining at hidden Japanese bars in Shimbashi. This tour is available from Monday to Friday from 17:00 - 21:00. Reservation for this food tour is difficult to make, so we suggest you to use our reservation service to book with no hassles!
strTitle: Enjoy A Wonderful Food Tour at Famous Food Spots in Tokyo!

strIntroduction: Join a Print Party and try the woodblock printmaking workshop at a warehouse in Asakusa, Tokyo! The warehouse is a wood printing workshop located in the Kaminarimon district of Asakusa, which is very close to Sensoji Temple. You will be printing your own designs on pre-carved woodblocks, with equipment and tools prepared by the staff of the warehouse. The staff will also lead through the wood printing process and teach you how to print your desings on woodblocks. You can make more than one wood printings, as you might fail your first print. You can also take home the printed woodblocks as souvenirs. Not only learning the wood printing process, you can also visit the printer’s workroom at the other end of the building. You can also enjoy a complimentary coffee and Japanese snacks corner, and you can also explore the shop of the warehouse to buy hand-made souvenirs. The party is available for three on the following schedules for most days: - From 10:00 - From 13:00 - From 14:30 The length of the party is 60 minutes. Please tell us about your available date so we can make a reservation for you!
strTitle: Join Wood Printing Event at a Warehouse in Asakusa, Tokyo!

strIntroduction: Join this program to experience a Japanese traditional art culture and make Makie, a decoration method applied on to lacquer coating. The Makie technique was fully developed in Kyoto, which is the cultural and political capital of Japan in the 6th Century. The process of Makie starts with drawing a pattern on a piece of wax paper, then pressing this wax paper onto a lacquer coated surface such as tray or bowl. After pressing the design of the pattern, you will trace it with a fine brush dipped into yellow-colored lacquer, which is a Cashew paint. Then you will sprinkle the gold or silver powder before the lacquer dries out and the powder will harden over night. This process is repeated over and over until the desired design is accomplished. The hands-on Makie introductory class at Inui offers you an unforgettable great cultural experience that is enjoyable and easy to understand. The individual class is available every Tuesdays and Fridays from 9:00 to 16:00. The individual class is also available for the additional dates listed below: - Aoi Matsuri Festival May 14, 15, 16th. - Gion Festival: July 14, 15, 16 and 17th) - Jidai Matsuri Festibal: October 24, 25th. Group class for 2 persons or more are available daily. All classes are available upon reservations. The length of the course is 90 minutes and available for minimum two persons. Use our reservation service to book this program and have fun making your own traditional Japanese souvenir only in Kyoto!
strTitle: Learn How to Make Makie At an Old Art Shop in Kyoto!

strIntroduction: Enrich your experience in Japan by joining this tour to enjoy a Japanese dinner with Geisha performance at Ryoutei in Tokyo! You can enjoy a traditional Japanese kaiseki dinner while watching the dance and music performance of Geisha. In addition, you can also enjoy real conversations with Geisha, since English translators or speakers will also be present in this program! The schedule of this program is as follows: 17:50 – Dinner Begins Talk with other international guest from around the world to make new friends, and change into kimono (or yukata) that is included in this program! 18:30 – Introduction to Geisha The interpreter will introduce you to the culture and history of Geisha while you are enjoying your meal. 19:00 – Geisha Performance Geisha will perform the traditional dances and songs. 19:30 – Q&A and Games Ask questions, learn more about Geisha and have some fun playing a few traditional Japanese games with them! 20:00 – Geisha Conversations Have fun stirring up conversation with Geisha as they pour you your drinks (the interpreter will help you translate the conversation with Geisha). 21:00 – Dinner ends Take photos and end your night by saying "Sayoonara" after making new friends and learning about the Geisha culture! The programs are available on Thursday and Saturday evenings at a ryoutei (traditional Japanese restaurant) near Asakusa, Tokyo. The price includes: - Kaiseki dinner (multi-course traditional Japanese meal) - Authentic geisha performance and entertainment - English interpreter - Kimono rental, free souvenirs, photo opportunities, and more.
strTitle: 10% OFF Geisha Performance with Dinner & Kimono Rental,Tokyo

strIntroduction: Enjoy learning tatami mat making at a tatami shop located in Kyoto! Tatami is a type of mat used as a flooring material in traditional Japanese-style rooms. The mats are traditionally made using rice straw (Igusa) to form the core, the cores of contemporary tatami are sometimes composed of compressed wood chip boards or polystyrene foam. The tatami are made in standard sizes, with the length exactly twice the width, with a ratio of 2:1. The long sides usually have edging of brocade or plain cloth, which is called heri. The contents of the tatami mats making class will be as follows: 1. History of Tatami 2. Effects of Tatami 3. Secrets of Igusa 4. Types of Tatami 5. Make your own mini Tatami The class is available from Monday to Friday, with the following schedules: 1. From 10:00 2. From 14:00 The length of the class is around 90 minutes. The class is not available on the weekends and on national holidays. The class is only available upon reservation, so we recommend you to use our reservation service to book it with no-hassles!
strTitle: Enjoy Japanese Tatami Making at a Tatami Shop in Kyoto!

strIntroduction: "Fuji-san in west, Tsukuba-san in east" Tsukuba-san (Mount Tsukuba) is referred as one of the best 100 Japanese mountains, similarly to Mount Fuji. It is also famous as a relatively easy to climb mountain because it is only 877-meter high. Tukuba Shrine is one of the most famous shrines in Japan. More than 200,000 worshipers go there every year. There are a lot of beautiful trees like plums (Ume), cherry trees (Sakura) and autumn color leaves. You will be able to enjoy the beautiful mountain view and the natural landscape. Tsukubasan has ropeway and a cable car so that you can enjoy the landscape and the fresh air. Recommended course: Enjoy shrine and landscape by vehicles. Tsukuba Station-Bus (40 min)-Miyawaki bus stop ->Tsukuba Shrine (30 min) Pray, check charm and stamp book, etc. ->Cable car (8 min)-Miyukigahara (Top field: 60 min. Restaurants) Walk to "Nyotai-san" (Top of Mt Tsukuba: 20min one way) Lucky stone throwing ->Rope way (6 min)-Bus (50 min)-Tsukuba Station Total 3 hours and 40 minutes. -Additional fees to pay on the day for transportation (Bus, Cable car, Ropeway) Adult: 2,620 JPY Child: 1,320 JPY Hiking course: If you want to enjoy hiking, please add 3-4 hours more (Total 6-7 hours). -Shirakumohashi course (up 110 min/ down 95 min) Benkei nanamodori, Hokutoiwa rock -Miyukigahara course(up 90 min/ down 70 min) Minanogawa river, Cable car passing More information: -Flower season Plum (Ume): Feburary to March Cherry (Sakura): end of March to mid-April Autumn leaves: end of October to end of November Vehicle timetables: Tsukuba Station 1st 6:55-7:38 from Station to Shrine last 21:20-22:03 from Shrine to Station Cable car 9:20-17:40 Rope way 9:00-18:20
strTitle: Visit a dignified shrine and explore Mt Tsukuba

strTitle: Try kart racing in Osaka, Japan!

strIntroduction: If you come to Nagano, visiting Zenkoji is a must to do. This walk gives you an opportunity to do a little more; either try Zazen (zen meditation) or try making a Kaleidoscope by yourself for your memory. First, we will meet at Nagano Station, and then you can choose to walk to Zenkoji (about 20 minutes) or take a bus to get to the gate to Zenkoji (public transportation). We will pass the gates and visit inside the temple. We can walk around the precincts and may try Okaidan Meguri, which is said to connect you with Buddha. (This may not be available when construction is going on or it is extremely crowded.) Then, we will take a look at the shops on the Sando (approach). There are many souvenir shops where you can pick up gifts to bring back home. We will visit a shukubo (inn) to try Zen meditation. Zazen is a type of meditation that is practiced by zen monks. You will sit in a certain posture and stay single-mindedly, breathe and be aware, to be free from all sorts of delusions and desires. It will be a great experience for you. Or, You can try out making a Kaleidoscope at an art shop located in a shukubo. It is made easy to do and you will enjoy showing your own creativity, not to mention you will have a great souvenir for yourself. The tour cost includes lunch or tea/coffee break, depending on the time.
strTitle: Visit Zenkoji Temple & Experience Zazen or Make Crafts

strIntroduction: Togakushi is located at the mountainous area north of Nagano city, which is a part of Myoko Togakushi Renzan National Park. This area has been famous for a Shinto shrine called "Togakushi-jinja" that was the center of ascetic practices as well as Ninja's training. We will meet at Nagano Station, and take a train to Kurohime. Then we will drive to Togakushi area. First, we will see Togakushi-jinja's Chusha, one of the most popular shrines. After that, we either walk or drive to Okusha area. Okusha and Kuzuryusha are located next to each other, but the approach to these shrines are about 2 km, and it is partly uphill, so it is recommended that you wear comfortable shoes! On the way to Okusha, you will find beautiful cedar trees on each side of the approach, as well as Zuijinmon, a shrine gate with a thatched roof beautifully colored in vermilion. Also, you will hear birds singing and see peaceful nature with trees and rivers. After that, we will visit Togakushi Folk Museum that introduces a collection of antiques and Ninja accessories. There is also Ninja karakuri House. "Karakuri" means "tricks", so you will find Ninja's tricks inside. Enjoy exploring inside just like you are a Ninja! Togakushi is one of the most famous areas for its soba (buckwheat) noodles. You can enjoy soba noodles at one of the local restaurants. If you would like to try making soba by yourself, you can choose to visit Soba Museum instead of going to the Folk Museum and Ninja House. At the Soba Museum, you can experience making soba and eat it after that for your lunch.
strTitle: Explore Togakushi Shrines & Ninja House in Nagano

strIntroduction: The tour starts with a hike through a beautiful forest and past several lakes. Discover various types of wild plants and flowers as you walk along the hiking trail to Kagami-ike Lake with its stunning view of Mt. Togakushi. On days with no wind, you can see Mt. Togakushi reflected on the water's surface. You will also pass by a panoramic spot where you can enjoy a view of the Japanese Alps. After a 2 hour hike, it is time for a lunch of Soba, or buckwheat noodles in English. It is a traditional dish for people in Nagano, and Togakushi especially is known for the distinctive taste of their soba made with region's clean mountain water. The dish comes with shrimp and seasonal vegetables tempura. After lunch, take the bus to the entrance of pilgrimage path to the Togakushi Okusha Shrine. While the entire Togakushi area is regarded as sacred to followers of Shintoism, Togakushi Okusha Shrine is the most important place within the region and the very end of the regional pilgrimage. Approximately 300 Cryptomeria trees are lined beautifully along the pilgrimage path. It is more than impressive enough to make visitors ponder the sacredness of Japanese Shintoism. After walking back from the Okusha Shrine, it is time for some recreation and learning at the Ninja Folklore Museum. At the museum, you will not only learn about the history and techniques used by the Togakushi ninja, you can also give escaping a ninja house filled with hidden doors and tricks a go. Tour itinerary: 09:00 Meet at Nagano station directly in front of the Shinkansen exit at the information board towards the East Exit. - Take the bus towards Togakushi. - Start the hike through the forest trail with several ponds and mountain views. 12:45 Eat lunch at a local soba restaurant - Take the bus to Togakushi Shrine and walk past the Japanese cedars. - Go to the Ninja House that also holds a Ninja Folklore Museum. 17:07 Go back by bus to Nagano Station. 18:20 Arrive back at Nagano Station.
strTitle: 1-Day Togakushi Nature Trekking and Ninja tour

strIntroduction: This activity offers the experience to cook rice in a traditional way, using an old rice cooker which is very rare in people’s lives now. Although the rice made in this way is still considered as the best, almost all the people use an electric rice cooker and so it is even rare for Japanese people to experience this way of cooking rice. In addition, the guests will use traditional fireplace to grill famous Hida Beef. What makes this activity more attractive are 1) the lecturer is a very experienced, 70-year old mother in the region who knows everything unique to the region; 2) the guest room, where the guests will eat lunch, is one of the oldest houses in Hida with high cultural values.
strTitle: Have a Traditional Lunch Experience in Hida-Takayama Area

strIntroduction: The concept of this cooking class is designed for guests to experience the lives and culture of locals in the Hida Takayama area. This cooking class begins by escaping from the hustle and bustle that is Takayama to Hida Furukawa. You will then enter a local host's beautiful home where the class will be held. You can learn how to make local food and ask questions about not only food but also regarding the locals' lifestyle and culture. The lecturer is not a professional chef but an experienced home cook who is passionate about food and speaking English. Having lived in Australia, she speaks English well, making it easy for the guests to enjoy communicating with the lecturer. The class size is limited to 6 people in order to make sure to keep a personalized experience. During the class, all recipes and ingredients will be handed out to the guests so that the guests can recreate it. The class will usually have the following menu: 2 side dishes 1 main dish Miso soup Rice steamed with vegetables Dessert *Menu is subject to change
strTitle: Enjoy Cooking Class In Japan's Countryside at a Local House

strIntroduction: This is a two hour long bus tour of Tokyo. Ride on an amphibious bus and enjoy the sights both from land and water! The Sky Duck, the amphibious bus operated by the Hinomaru Limousine Group takes you around the Sky Tree and Kameido area, where you'll be able to see post-war era homes, stores and popular ramen and gyoza restaurants. The tour has two different routes available. The first route, called the Sky Tree course starts at the Tokyo Sky Tree. A broadcast tower complex with restaurants and an observation deck. It is the tallest tower and the second tallest structure in the world. The bus will then splash into the Nakagawa river to continue the tour on water! The second route, called the Kameido course, begins at the newly built Kameido Umeyashiki, a beautiful mansion built in the style of the wealthy Edo period homes. The bus will then splash into the Nakagawa river to continue the tour on water! The tour departs from the Sky Tree Station Office at the following time slots: 09:10, 11:25, 13:25 and 15:25
strTitle: Explore Tokyo by bus and boat with this amphibious bus tour!

strIntroduction: This is a 1-day bus tour that will take to some of the mot interesting and historically significant sights in Kyoto: the Sennyuji Temple, the Daitokuji Temple and Kyoto Imperial Palace. The Sennyuji temple lies near Tofukuji in south west Kyoto close to the first Red Cross Hospital. The name of this Shingon sect temple means “Bubbling Spring,” and it has long been the location of a number of imperial tombs of emperors and empresses. The Daitokuji temple is a large enclosed temple complex in northern Kyoto and the head temple of the Rinzai sect's Daitokuji school of Japanese Zen Buddhism. The complex consists of nearly two dozen sub temples and is one of the best places in Japan to see a wide variety of Zen gardens and to experience Zen culture and architecture. In Daitokuji, you can enjoy shojin ryori (literally meaning devotion cuisine), a type of vegetarian cooking introduced to Japan along with Buddhism in the 6th century. Kyoto Imperial Palace used to be the residence of Japan's Imperial Family until 1868, when the emperor and capital were moved from Kyoto to Tokyo. It is located in the spacious Kyoto Imperial Park, an attractive green area in the center of the city that also encompasses the Sento Imperial Palace and a few other attractions. The tour departs from Kyoto Station's Karasuma Exit at 10:50 and has a total duration of approximately 6 hours. The tour is only available during weekdays.
strTitle: Enjoy a 1-day bus tour to popular temples in Kyoto

strIntroduction: Kyoto, once capital of Japan and residence of the Emperor for over 1000 years, it is now renowned for its rich traditional culture as well as the unique modern pace. Learn about the historical and natural charm of the city by joining this special sightseeing bus tour. After meeting up at the pick-up location of your choice, the tour starts at Nijo Castle, which was built to provide lodging for Tokugawa Shogun - the first Shogun in Edo period (1603-1867). Its grand design exemplifies the typical castle architecture in Japan's feudal era and was designated a World Heritage Site in 1994 by UNESCO. After 50 minutes, the tour moves on to Kinkakuji Temple, where you can admire the luxurious beauty of the golden leaf-coated temple and learn about its enduring vitality that has kept it from destruction by countless wars. If you take this tour on a weekday, the third destination will be Kyoto Imperial Palace, located within the beautiful gardens of Kyoto Gyoen. This used to be the residence of the Emperor of Japan until 1869, and now it's one of the best tourist attractions in Kyoto. However, the Palace is closed on weekends and holidays. So if you take the tour on these ocasions, the tour will visit instead Kitano Tenmangu Shrine, the house of the God of Scholarship. This is a popular shrine for students seeking to pass their admission exams to university. After lunch, you will experience various kinds of traditional Japan arts and crafts such as block print or cloisonné work at Kyoto Handicraft center, the final destination of the tour.
strTitle: Explore Kyoto's popular sights and visit a crafts workshop

strIntroduction: This is a one day bus tour that will take you to the Kajuji Temple, the Daigoji Temple, the Byodoin Hoodo, the Mimurotoji Temple and the Manpukuji Temple. The Kajuji temple is especially famous for its water lily pond. Daigoji is an important temple of the Shingon sect of Japanese Buddhism and a designated world heritage site. Byodoin Hoodo is a striking example of Buddhist Pure Land (Jodo) architecture; together with its garden, the temple represents the Pure Land Paradise and was influential on later temple construction. Its hall is now featured on the back of the Japanese 10 yen coin. Mimurotoji is a temple in the northern hills of Uji city, founded about 1200 years ago. It is also known as the “flower temple”, as its wide temple grounds offer large gardens of some varieties of seasonal flowers. The Manpukuji Temple is a head temple of the Zen Sect (Obaku Sect). It was opened by Ingen, a Chinese priest, who came to Japan in the early Edo period. The tour departs form Kyoto Station Karasuma Exit at 9:40 and has a total duration of approximately 6.5hours. You'll have time to have lunch in Uji (not included)
strTitle: Enjoy a 1-Day Bus Tour to Popular Temples in Kyoto and Uji!

strIntroduction: Kyoto is one of the most visited places in Japan for its traditional atmosphere and historical sights. It has always been at the crossroads of Japanese history, and it was the capital of Japan for over 1,000 years. Even today, Kyoto is the cultural center of Japan, and continues to be loved by Japanese and foreigners alike. The best way to experience it's historical legacy is by joining a one day bus tour around some of the city's most iconic temples. One of them is Hieizan Enryakuji temple, located in Kyoto's eastern mountain range on Mt. Hieizan. It is one of the most important monasteries in Japanese history and the headquarters of the Tendai sect of Japanese Buddhism. Many influential monks have studied at Enryakuji, including the founders of a number of later sects, such as the Pure Land (Jodo), Zen and Nichiren sects. The other stop on this one day bus tour is Ohara, a rural town nestled in the mountains of northern Kyoto, but still technically located within Kyoto's city limits. Ohara is best known for Sanzenin Temple, located way up the forested mountains in the east of Ohara. It is a large temple with a variety of buildings and gardens, and was established in the early Heian Period (794-1185) by the great monk Saicho, who founded the Tendai sect of Japanese Buddhism. The path from the town to the temple is lined with numerous small shops. One of the local specialties on sale is Aisu kyuri, cucumbers pickled in seaweed flavored ice water and served on a stick. The bus departs from Kyoto Station Karasuma Exit at 9:20 and has a total duration of 7 hours. You'll have time in Ohara to have lunch (not included).
strTitle: Enjoy Kyoto's mystic temples with a 1-day bus tour

strIntroduction: On this tour, you will be able to visit the most beautiful places in Kyoto and Arashiyama. The first place you will visit is Daikakuji a 1200 year-old temple where you will be able to experience "sutra transcribing" (the East Asian practice of hand-copying Buddhist sutras). The next place is Nonomiya Shrine which was mentioned in the worlds oldest epic novel "The Tale of Genji". After visiting the shrine, you will walk through a beautiful narrow path called Sagano Bamboo Grove, surrounded by bamboos which stretch from the shrine to Tenryuji Temple where you will have a lunch called "shojin ryouri," which is Buddhist vegetarian cuisine. After the lunch you will go to Togetsukyo Bridge where you will be able to view the beautiful scenery of mountains and Oi River. Then you will be able to experience a rickshaw ride and enjoy seeing the local scenery of Arashiyama. The final place on the tour is Matsuno-o Taisha Shrine, one of the oldest shrines in Kyoto, which is about 1300 years old. Schedule: 08:50 Depart from Karasuma Kyoto Hotel 09:40 - 11:00 Daikakuji Temple (80 min) 11:10 - 11:30 Nonomiya Shrine (20 min) 11:40 - 12:00 Stroll through Sagano Bamboo Grove (20 min) 12:00 - 13:30 Tenryuji Temple & Lunch (90 min) 13:40 - 14:00 Togetsukyo Bridge (20 min) 14:00 - 14:10 Rickshaw ride (10 min) 14:30 - 15:10 Matsuno-o Taisha Shrine 15:30 - 16:00 Drop off service to hotels in Kyoto
strTitle: Enjoy 1-Day Premium Tour in Kyoto and Arashiyama!

strIntroduction: On this activity, you can visit Kinkakuji, Kiyomizudera, and Kodaiji Temples, and stroll around the Higashiyama area. The Kinkakuji and Kiyomizudera temples are both designated as UNESCO World Heritage Sites. The Kinkakuji is one of the most popular sightseeing spots in Kyoto and most are attracted by its shining gold temple and it's definitely worth seeing to experience Japanese culture. The Kiyomizudera Temple is also well-known as one of the most famous places for tourists from all over the world to visit and even for Japanese too. From the main hall of this temple you can see the beautiful view of Kyoto city. Kodaiji Temple, officially named Kodaiji-jushozenji temple, is located at the foot of the Higashiyama Ryozen mountains and was established in 1606 by Nene, who is the widow of Toyotomi Hideyoshi, to pray for her late husband. At Kodaiji temple you can see so many historical things and places such as the Otama-ya (Sanctuary) as well as Hideyoshi's Jinbaori (a coat worn over armour), which are designated as important cultural properties of Japan. In Higashiyama ward, you can explore various kinds of traditional shrines and temples. On this tour you can take a stroll around Higashiyama to enjoy visiting historical places and feel traditional Kyoto culture. You can even relax among the greenery by exploring places encompassed by beautiful trees or flowers and by passing through a tunnel of trees. It's a place that you can enjoy in every season! This tour is available everyday until March 17th, 2017. The bus will depart everyday at 12:30.
strTitle: Visit Kinkakuji Temple & Stroll around Higashiyama, Kyoto

strIntroduction: In this 5-hour bus tour, you can visit Kyoto's best 3 tourist attractions which are the Kinkakuji, Ginkakuji, and Kiyomizudera Temples at an excellent price. Don't miss this opportunity to fully experience Kyoto's traditional culture by visiting these popular sightseeing spots! The Kinkakuji Temple, also known as the Golden Pavilion, or Rokuonji, is one of the most popular spots for tourists. A Zen buddhist temple, it has also been selected as one of the Historic Monuments of Ancient Kyoto by the UNESCO World Heritage organization. In addition to being designated as a National Special Historic Site it has also been designated a National Special Landscape. With its fascinating and gorgeous appearance of shining gold, the Kinkakuji has attracted millions of visitors. So, if you are fascinated by the Kinkakuji, don't hesitate to reserve this tour. The Ginkakuji Temple, officially named Jishoji, is one of the constructions that represents Higashiyama culture from the Muromachi period. The garden around the Ginkakuji is famous for its beautiful scenery and when you get to Sengetsusen, which is the small waterfall in the temple, you may see many coins thrown in the water like the Trevi Fountain in Italy. In Japanese, there is a famous expression "to jump off the stage at Kiyomizu", which is equivalent of the English expression"to take the plunge". This expression comes from the Kiyomizudera Temple which is also included in this tour. The Hondo (main hall) of this temple is known as the "stage" of Kiyomizudera and from its 18m high cliff you can see the panoramic view of Kyoto city. If you join this tour, you can explore the 3 best temples in Kyoto and learn about its history. The tour is very popular so it's best to hurry up and reserve your seats before they sell out! This tour is available everyday until March 17th, 2017. The bus will depart at 09:00, 10:30, 11:30. Notice: The bus departing at 11:30 will only be available on Saturdays, Sundays and national holidays. Although, it will be operated everyday from December 31st to January 3rd, it will not be operated from January 4th to February 28th.
strTitle: Explore the 3 Best Tourist Attractions in Kyoto!

strIntroduction: This is the ultimate Karaoke experience in the center of Tokyo. Karaoke47 which is at the top floor of Keio Plaza Hotel and offers a 3-hour plan to enjoy Karaoke, 7-course dinner, all-you-can-drink beverages and gorgeous night view all at once! The hotel is within 5-minute walking distance from Shinjuku Station, and Karaoke47 is on the top floor offering easy access, via its convenient location, to everybody. The rooms are stylish to enhance the wonderful night view of Tokyo, yet comfortable to make you feel at home. All you have to do is just relax and enjoy your fun time!! A 7-course dinner will be served to make your experience special. Here is the menu. 1. Appetizer 2. Salad 3. 2 selections of hot vegetables 4. Fish 5. Meat 6. Pasta 7. Fruits Details may vary depending on the season and the weather. The choices of all-you-can-drink beverages are from sparkling wine, cocktail, beer, whiskey, wine, shochu (Japanese spirits distilled from barley or sweet potato), shochu highball and soft-drinks. The room holds up to 15 people and suits any occasion, like birthday parties, friends' get-together, company year-end parties, whatever you can imagine. Plans are operated daily from 17:00 to 23:30. Enjoy karaoke with your friends, co-workers, family and other precious people.
strTitle: Enjoy Luxurious Karaoke at Karaoke47, Shinjuku!

strIntroduction: Iwamura is a small town in Ena city, located in the southeast part of Gifu prefecture. Its roots can be traced back to the Edo period (17-19th century). Iwamura then fell into obscurity, allowing many of its houses and shops to remain relatively unchanged. Enjoy visiting an unaltered and unadulterated part of Japan. Meet your guide at Ena Station at 9:00 am and take a local train, Akechi railways, for Iwamura town. Along the way you can see beautiful nature and rice fields from the train. It is about a thirty minute train trip. (The departure time at Ena station is 9:28 am on weekends and holidays and 9:15 am on weekdays. The arrival time at Iwamura station is 9:57 am on weekends and holidays and 9:44 am on weekdays.) Walk to the main street of Iwamura castle town. It has been selected as "Important Preservation District Groups of Historic Buildings". The streets also have been selected as one of the best 100 beautiful historical landscapes in Japan. Visit the Kimura house which preserves the style of the Edo period. Visit Tosaya's house which was a shop for dyeing kimono. You can learn the unique ideas and skills of the ancient people in the town. Katukawa's house belonged to one of the local rich families. After the walking tour, we will make Japanese zori sandals together out of recycled-shirt fabric and kimono silk — a comfortable and fashionable souvenir. The instructor will teach you how to make it. We will have late lunch at one of the local restaurants after making sandals. Enjoy delicious local foods and sweets with traditional manufacturing. Go to the local sake brewery, Onna-joshu, at the end and see various sake brands. Take the local train for Ena at 4:45 pm when the tour ends.
strTitle: Make Japanese sandals in historical castle town Iwamura

strIntroduction: What you can enjoy in this one day tour to Ibaraki's countryside: - You will enjoy visiting the tallest statue of standing Buddha in the world. - You will climb up to the chest of the statue from where you can enjoy the panorama scenery (extra fee) - You can enjoy rabbit feeding and monkey tricks in front of the statue (extra fee) - After seeing the statue, we will enjoy shopping at the shopping mall near the statue. There are brand shop like Coach, A.v.v, Levi's, Polo Ralph Lauren, Ray-Ban, etc. The tour duration will be 3-4 hours. Pick up by car is available from Tsukuba Station, JR Tsuchiura Station or any nearby station (hotel) Optional fees (please pay on the day): - 800 JPY: climb inside the statue, garden and rabbit feeding - 500 JPY: garden and rabbit feeding only
strTitle: Visit Ushiku Daibutsu and enjoy shopping in Ibaraki!

strIntroduction: You will visit many popular and historic places by bicycle and you can experience and feel Japanese culture and traditions all in one day! Make your own souvenir leather key holders at the leather factory which goes back three generations. Take coffee break at Japanese coffe roastery in Kiyosumishirakawa. Kiyosumishirakawa is a famous erea for Third-wave coffee nowadays. There are some nice Japanese coffee roastaries there. Make your original Shichimi. Shichimi is Japanese traditional spice. The special blender blends Shichimi in response to your requests. Sightsee at a 100% organic Green Tea shop. This Green Tea shop is running by Green Tea farmer. You can drink and buy some fresh Green teas. Also it is very good for souvenir. Course: CYT→Kuramaebashi Bridge→Sumidagawa River→Sumidagawa Terrace→Kiyosumishirakawa→Higashimukoujima→Kuramae→KappaBashi→Asakusa→CYT

strIntroduction: Spend a fun-filled day with your family outside of Tokyo by heading out to the popular Mother Farm and Mitsui Outlet Shopping Mall. The bus will take you to every place with an English guiding. Rainbow Bridge: Travel across the 798-meter suspension bridge and see Tokyo Tower from your window. Get a 360-degree panoramic view of Tokyo, Chiba and Kanagawa while going across the Tokyo Bay. Stop over at the Umihotaru rest area. In the case the Tokyo Bay Aqua Line is closed, you will be going through the Metropolitan Expressway Bayshore Route. Mother Farm: Sheep, alpaca, and capybaras greet you on the farm. Take this great opportunity to also experience an interactive session with the animals such as cow milking and pigs race. You'll also be served BBQ lunch. After lunch, you can enjoy the fresh ice cream on the farm. Fruit Picking: Blueberries and, strawberries are available during the right season. In the case fruit is not available due to the season or weather, you will take pre-picked fruit home as a souvenir. Mitsui Outlet Mall: Take your time going through the many shops that make up one of the largest malls in the Kanto region. Receive a special discount coupon you can use at different shops. If less than 10 participants are booked, the activity may not operate. +Vegetarian and lamb meals (instead of pork) are available upon request. However, the request must be made at least two business days in advance. +Children between 3-5 years old will be required to pay an admission fee of JPY 1,800 to the Mother farm and orchard, which can be paid on site. +If the fruits are not ripe for picking due to weather conditions, the activity may be cancelled. The fruit-picking activity will be held outdoors. Depending on the weather, the group may only have the all-you-can-eat fruits activity instead. +Fruit picking from March to May will be for strawberries and from July to August will be for blueberries, In the case the fruit is not available due to the season or weather, you will be receiving a different type of pre-picked fruit as a souvenir. +The tour will still be conducted even if flowers are not in full bloom. In that case, refunds will not be issued. +Children (ages 0-5 years) will be able to participate for free under the following conditions. An individual seat will not be provided. Please have them sit on the lap of their parent or guardian. If there are seats available, they are welcome to use it, however, they will not be getting a priority in seating. An individual meal or snack will not be provided as well. +If you would like any of the above for children (ages 0-5 years), please book them as a child. +In the case the Tokyo Aqua Line and Rainbow Bridge are closed due to the weather or road conditions, you will be going through the Metropolitan Expressway Bayshore Route instead. +Please understand that the tour itinerary is subject to change according to the road or viewing conditions.
strTitle: Book a Farm Visit and Outlet Park Shopping Tour in Chiba

strIntroduction: This is a full day tour. We will start from Kyoto and go back at night. Adult (age 12 & over) and child (age 6-11) will be charged differently and infants (Age 0-5) are free. We will pick you up at your hotel. The details of this tour are down below: 1. Nijo Castle It is one of the seventeen Historic Monuments of Ancient Kyoto which have been designated by UNESCO as a World Heritage Site. 2. Kinkakuji Temple (Golden Pavilion) It is one of the most popular buildings in Japan, attracting a large number of visitors annually. 3. Kyoto Imperial Palace It is the former ruling palace of the Emperor of Japan.It has been destroyed and rebuilt eight times. The version currently standing was completed in 1855. 4. Japanese Style Lunch Visit Nara in the afternoon. 5. Todaiji Temple and Nara Park The Great Buddha Hall located at Todaiji Temple has the world's largest bronze statue of the Buddha Vairocana. Over 1,200 wild sika deer freely roam around Nara Park and that's the reason why this place has such a high reputation around the world. 6. Kasuga Taisha Shrine The interior is famous for its many bronze lanterns, as well as the many stone lanterns that lead up the shrine. 7. Nara Nagomikan It is the biggest gift shop in Nara. After shopping, we will head to Kyoto and end our journey. Attention: 1. The Kyoto Imperial Palace is closed on Saturdays, Sundays, and national holidays. We will then visit Kitano Tenmangu Shrine instead. And on Jan. 25, Apr. 25, Jul. 25 and Oct. 25, we will visit Nishi Honganji Temple instead. 2. Nijo Castle is closed on Tuesdays (or Wednesday if Tuesday is a national holiday) in January, July, August, and December and over the year-end New Year's holidays. We will then visit Ryoanji Temple instead. 3. We may skip the Nara Nagomikan according to any situations that may arise. 4. Areas requiring additional fees are not included. 5. This tour is not suitable for groups (5 & more) of Japanese only because you will not be able to enter the Kyoto Imperial Palace according to this tour plan. Pickup time & Pickup point. 08:35 Ana Hotel Kyoto 08:30 Hotel Nikko Princess Kyoto 08:40 Karasuma Kyoto Hotel 08:20 Kyoto Hotel Okura 08:25 Kyoto Avanti 08:40 Kyoto Tokyu Hotel
strTitle: Explore Kyoto and Nara in a 1-Day Bus Tour

strIntroduction: In this tour, you will be able to visit 3 World Heritage Sites in Kyoto by bus. First, you will take the JR line from Kyoto Station to visit Fushimi Inari Taisha shrine. The shrine is the head shrine of all 40,000 inari-jinja shrines located all over Japan, and there are thousands of torii (red gate for shrine) placed across the mountain. This spot is interesting and enjoyable even if you do not have interest in shrines or temples. Next, you will visit Kiyomizudera Temple, where there is a famous stage which is 18 meters high from the bottom of the cliff projecting like a balcony. You will be able to enjoy the view of Kyoto there. After departing from the temple, you will have lunch at Shijo Karasuma. You can either take your own lunch or have a delicious buffet. The last place you will visit is Kinkakuji Temple where there is a famous golden building. The building is reflecting on the pond which makes the scenery more beautiful. This is a must-see spot. There are 4 options available in this tour: 1. strIntroduction: This one hour and a half bus tour of Kyoto departs from JR Kyoto Station at Karasuma entrance. Unlike other bus city tours, the Sky Bus is an open top bus, allowing you unobstructed, panoramic views of Kyoto's sightseeing spots. You'll be able to take amazing pictures of the sights without leaving the comfort of your seat. The bus has audio guides available in English, Chinese and Korean, so you will be able to learn about the sights while enjoying the breeze and sunlight on your face as you make your way through the city. Some of the iconic sights that you'll be able to appreciate from the bus include Kyoto Tower, Sanjusangendo Buddhist temple, the Kyoto National Museum, Yasaka shrine, Heian Jingu shrine, Nijo Castle, among many more. Don't miss the chance to experience Kyoto in a different, more exciting way! Schedule (morning tour): 11:00 Meeting at Kyoto Station Karasuma Bus Terminal - Nishihonganji Temple - Nijo Castle - Reizei House - Kyoto Gardens - Kamocho Bridge - Lake Biwa Canal - Heian Shrine - Shorenin Temple - Chionin Temple - Yasaka Shrine - Kyoto National Museum - Sanjusangendo - Kyoto tower 12:30 Tour ends at Kyoto Station Karasuma Bus Terminal.
